alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Monmouth; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 01 at 7:18PM EDT until April 01 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN OCEAN...SOUTHEASTERN MERCER AND SOUTHWESTERN MONMOUTH COUNTIES... At 718 PM EDT, a severe squall line capable of producing both tornadoes and extensive straight line wind damage was located over Imlaystown, or 14 miles east of Trenton, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Lakewood, Jackson, Roosevelt, Cassville, Adelphia, Clarksburg, Vista Center, Woodruff, Six Flags Theme Park, Imlaystown, Cream Ridge, Cedar Glen West, Freewood Acres, Jacksons Mills, West Freehold, Freehold, New Egypt and Leisure Knoll. This includes Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 9 and 28. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. This cluster of thunderstorms is capable of producing tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
